column4: What is the proper way to remove a PPA from the command line?
that's what I found on google bu tI don't have that command installed
not thought to install it then...?
guess.. it's pretty obvious in this case
... it's not in the standard repos?
if you run a command and its not installed, the OS will suggest the packagename to install
I have universe enabled, still not showing up ..
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install ppa-purge
can you give a pastebin of the output of:  gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
ok, then run:  sudo apt-get install pastebinit; pastebinit /etc/apt/sources.list
pastebinit is a cli pastebin command, dead handy
you can give an option to use a different bin, not sure what a bad pastebni is tbh
copying line numbers w source code, font that makes it hard to distinguish between 1 and l, O and 0, tiny font, among other things
ok, basically the PPAs make files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d    if you delete the files in that folder relating to the PPA, it will do the same thing
